DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate clinical benefits of a novel sleep-focused mind-body program on Gulf War Illness (GWI) symptoms.
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Benefits of a Novel Sleep-focused Mind-body Program on Gulf War Illness (GWI) Symptoms
DOC.detailed_description: This randomized study investigates whether two treatment conditions:Mind-Body Bridging (MBB) and Supportive Education (SED) are effective in improving sleep disturbance and self-reported indicators of other co-morbid symptoms in veterans with GWI. The two treatment conditions will each comprise 3 sessions of 2 hr. duration and conducted over 3 consecutive weeks (Week 1-3).
DOC.criteria: Veteran from First Gulf War Suffering from sleep disturbance Has other chronic symptoms of Gulf War Illness: fatigue chronic headaches joint/muscle pain cognitive difficulties memory/concentration problems shortness of breath gastrointestinal symptoms terminally ill a highly unstable medical or psychiatric condition Parkinson disease dementia of any cause Nocturia delayed/advanced sleep phase syndrome Narcolepsy
